title: Vote share giants, seat share dwarfs: RJD's stunning Bihar polls paradox - explained
description: Bihar's 2025 election saw the RJD secure the highest vote share but a drastically low seat tally, while the NDA achieved a landslide victory. The RJD's votes were spread thinly, resulting in many second-place finishes, a consequence of India's 'First Past the Post' system. The NDA's strategic alliances and efficient vote conversion led to their dominant win.

title: DMs and drones: Amritsar police busts Pakistan-linked arms & drugs network; five arrested

FIRs have been registered, and efforts continue to root out the entire syndicate.

South Africa secured a historic Test win in India, defending 124 runs on a challenging Eden Gardens pitch. The post-match exchange signaled that there were no hard feelings between the two.

title: IND vs SA: Unbeaten in 11 matches! Bavuma yet to lose a Test as South Africa captain
description: South Africa secured a significant 30-run victory over India in the opening Test, marking their first win in the country in 15 years. India's batting struggled against quality spin, being bowled out for 93 while chasing 124. This result extends Proteas captain Temba Bavuma's impressive unbeaten run. It was India’s fourth home defeat in their last six Tests.

Nadella stressed that the AI era's success will be measured by real-world industry gains, not just tech valuations.

title: Disha Patani’s father Jagdish Patani gets weapons license after Bareilly home attack
description: Jagdish Patani, father of actress Disha Patani, received a firearm license after gunmen fired at their Bareilly home. Following the attack, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath assured security. Police killed the suspects in a Ghaziabad encounter. Meanwhile, Disha is busy with upcoming films like Welcome to the Jungle and Holiguards.

title: How 39,000-year-old ancient RNA from a mammoth found in Siberia reveals its biology
description: Scientists have recovered ancient RNA from a 39,000-year-old woolly mammoth in Siberia, offering an unprecedented glimpse into its biology.  Preserved by permafrost, the RNA reveals gene activity related to muscle, cell maintenance, and stress, providing insights into the Ice Age giant's life and cellular functions. This discovery highlights the remarkable endurance of biomolecules and the potential of frozen archives.

title: 'Do not get on a boat': UK rolls out toughest asylum overhaul in decades
description: Britain is set to implement a significantly tougher immigration policy, mirroring Denmark's strict asylum framework. The proposed reforms include a 20-year wait for permanent settlement for asylum seekers and a reduction in initial refugee leave. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood stated the measures aim to deter illegal migration and unite the country amidst growing public concern.

title: With prices on boil, Trump lowers duties on tea, spices
description: US President Donald Trump has lowered import duties on nearly 200 food and agricultural items, including spices and tea, to ease rising domestic prices. This move provides a significant boost to India's key agri exports, though seafood and basmati rice remain under tariff sanctions. The exemptions aim to create a level playing field for Indian products in the US market.

description: Twenty-eight blackbucks have died at Belagavi's Rani Channamma Mini Zoo in three days, with preliminary investigations pointing to a bacterial infection. Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre has ordered a probe by experts and instructed zoo staff to isolate the remaining animals to prevent further spread of the disease.

BJP leaders highlighted Modi's consistent ability to embrace local culture, turning a political victory into a shared celebration.

title: 'Such actions will only fuel anger': Omar Abdullah on demolition of Dr Umar’s house
description: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah condemned the demolition of a Delhi "suicide bomber's" family home, questioning its effectiveness in combating terrorism.  Security forces razed the two-storey house in Pulwama, sparking criticism from PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti and NC MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, who labelled it "collective punishment" and an act of cruelty during harsh winter conditions.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
description: WhatsApp now allows users to message without saving numbers. This feature, 'Click to Chat,' lets you initiate conversations via a special link. You can even pre-fill messages. Businesses can use the official 'Chat on WhatsApp' button on their sites for easy customer contact, streamlining communication and decluttering your phone.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
description: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.

title: Which Vitamin is called anti-cancer vitamin, and why its deficiency is linked to the disease
description: Vitamin D comes from three sources: the sunshine that reaches our skin, the foods we eat, and the supplements we take. Getting a dose-whether via safe sun exposure, food, or a pill, helps maintain vitamin D levels at a sweet spot, that’s been linked to better cancer outcomes. Research shows that a consistent daily regimen, outperforms occasional high‑dose bursts when it comes to lowering cancer mortality.
